Posts.Content: racingheart wrote: I'm still waiting but did have my mammogram and ultrasound yesterday. My family doctor marked it as a rush so I should know today or tomorrow. I'm still at that painless little lump that is now painful because I can't stop feeling it hoping it's gone or smaller.  So nervous waiting for the phone to ring and I fluctuate between terror, crying and cleaning like a tornado.  I will update my results when I can and you are all in my thoughts. Posts.Title: Very small update racingheart racingheart

Posts.Content: Sep 7, 2014 04:49PM racingheart wrote: Thank you all so much for your support.  I'm starting to wonder if the results as to which breast were misread.  Mammo said no change from my routine one 11 months ago.  Ultrasound picked up the complex cyst.  Problem is I don't feel a lump on my right.  The entire thing started when I felt a lump on my left that wasn't there before.  It's tiny and rock hard.  Can a complex cyst be smaller than a pea size?  (I'm asking these questions because I'm trying very hard to stay away from google).  By the time I get into specialist and if it is the wrong breast and I have to get mammo and u/s redone it will take so much longer.  I'm thinking of going back to Radiologist and get them redone before my appointment.  They have made mistakes before.  I had to have a thyroid biopsy years ago because the radiology report read that it grew 6 mm and my specialist found that in fact it had only grown .6 mm and there was no reason to have had that biopsy.  Perhaps I'm wrong and my new tiny left breast cyst is ok and I just can't feel the right but something's telling me something's not right.  One more question.  My doctor is making an appointment with the specialist that deals with breasts.  What kind of specialist would I be seeing?  Thanks again
Posts.Title: I have results but still confused racingheart racingheart

Posts.Content: racingheart wrote: I just got off the phone with my family doctor.  She said the mammogram showed no significant change but the ultrasound showed a complex cyst in my right breast.  It was the left breast where I felt that small hard lump.  My doctor and I both checked my right breast and didn't feel anything.  She's referring me to breast specialist and will try to get me in as soon as possible.  I'm terrified now.  Does anyone know what a complex cyst means?  Can it be many things?  Could it be cancer?  I'm so overwhelmed.  I hope I've made sense. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: I have results but still confused racingheart racingheart

Posts.Content: Sep 8, 2014 01:15PM racingheart wrote: Hi Dora I'm new to the boards and I'm still waiting to see the specialist.  I'll be going for complex cysts but wanted you to know when I was younger in my 30's and 40's I had what you're describing all the time.  My doctor said I had fibrocystic breasts.  Mine would come and go then get bigger then smaller.  I would have heaviness in the breast that  happened to be worse at the time and they would also feel hot and very sore at times and then fine.  This went on until menopause for me which was a long time.  As to what you should do I'll tell you what I did.  I went in for ultrasounds every few years and my doctor would check and everything was fine but everyone is different and you should probably see your doctor and ask for what you feel you need for you.  Hope this helps a bit. Hugs racingheart
Posts.Title: Can symptoms change/go away? DoraFlora racingheart

Posts.Content: Sep 9, 2014 04:04PM racingheart wrote: Dora, my doctor thought that it might be fibrocystic breasts but was confirmed by the ultrasound.  I had gone in to see my dr. because I had a few lumps that were so painful and hot.  I'm small breasted but if I just walked fast I felt I needed to hold them up.  It had been happening on and off for quite a while but then it just got too painful.   All I ever took in the way of meds was extra strength Tylenol and only once in a while.  They said at the time there was nothing they could do and I would have to put up with it and put up with it I did!  It wasn't bad all the time, I would go months and be ok then it would start again.  When I was going through menopause that all stopped although I've always had nodules but the pain and flare up thing went away.  Again, this was my experience and I think you should get an ultrasound done or whatever your doctor recommends.  I hope all goes well for you. Hugs
Posts.Title: Can symptoms change/go away? DoraFlora racingheart
